The last kind of variable I like to talk about is a class variable.
What's cool about a class variable is that it's think of it like a shared resource.
So it's a variable that any instance of this particular type can access and modify.
And if it's modified, all the other instances will see this modified value, right?
So it's just shared across all the instances of type rabbit in this particular case.
And so there's many different ways to use class variables in object oriented programing.
